q: Whatever you do,strive to do it so well that no man living and no man dead and no man yet to be born could do it any better.
h:
“Whatever you do,strive to do it so well that no man living and no man dead and no man yet to be born could do it any better.” —
Benjamin Mays

q: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
h:
“Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.” —
Herodotus

q: Winners don't Quit. That's why they Win.
h:
“Winners don't Quit. That's why they Win.” —
Unknown

q: Don't wait for the right opportunity: create it.
h:
“Don't wait for the right opportunity: create it.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
h:
“Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
h:
“Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.” —
Alan Watts

q: We create the world and ourselves;
h:
“We create the world and ourselves;” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Adversity is the tempering of one's mettle. Without it, we cannot know any true meaning in our accomplishments.
h:
“Adversity is the tempering of one's mettle. Without it, we cannot know any true meaning in our accomplishments.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
h:
“The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Everything flows, nothing stands still.
h:
“Everything flows, nothing stands still.” —
Heraclitus

q: In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.
h:
“In order to carry a positive action, we must develop here a positive vision.” —
Dalai Lama

q: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
h:
“We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.
h:
“The soul is neither born, and nor does it die.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
h:
“You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.
h:
“Surround yourself with people who take their work seriously, but not themselves, those who work hard and play hard.” —
Colin Powell

q: If you want work well done, select a busy man; the other kind has no time.
h:
“If you want work well done, select a busy man; the other kind has no time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: There is a cosmic law which says that every satisfaction must be paid for with a dissatisfaction.
h:
“There is a cosmic law which says that every satisfaction must be paid for with a dissatisfaction.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.
h:
“Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.
h:
“Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
h:
“Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Great ones are willing to get burned time and again as they sharpen their swords in the fire.
h:
“Great ones are willing to get burned time and again as they sharpen their swords in the fire.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
h:
“By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.
h:
“If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.
h:
“Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
h:
“I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.” —
Richard Bach

q: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
h:
“Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
h:
“If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
h:
“Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Self-control is strength.
h:
“Self-control is strength.” —
James Allen

q: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.
h:
“I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
h:
“A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.” —
Criss Jami

q: The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
h:
“The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
h:
“Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
h:
“Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.” —
Alfred Adler

q: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
h:
“A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If you truly expect something to be difficult, it will be.
h:
“If you truly expect something to be difficult, it will be.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
h:
“Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.
h:
“You can't have anything worthwhile without difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.
h:
“If we will be quiet and ready enough, we shall find compensation in every disappointment.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must.
h:
“Enjoy when you can, and endure when you must.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
h:
“A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.” —
Colin Powell

q: Your spirit is the true shield.
h:
“Your spirit is the true shield.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be.
h:
“When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you'd like them to be.” —
Leo Tolstoy

q: Simple words, repeated daily, can change your life.
h:
“Simple words, repeated daily, can change your life.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.
h:
“The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goals to reach.” —
Benjamin Mays

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: If you're brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello.
h:
“If you're brave enough to say goodbye, life will reward you with a new hello.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Think and wonder, wonder and think.
h:
“Think and wonder, wonder and think.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
h:
“The more we value things, the less we value ourselves. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: The key to success is failure.
h:
“The key to success is failure.” —
Michael Jordan
